data.title: Chiang Kai
data.text:
Chiang Kai-Shek

Born: 31-Oct-1887

Birthplace: Hsikow, Chekiang, China

Died: 5-Apr-1975

Location of death: Taipei, Taiwan

Cause of death: Heart Failure

Remains: Buried, Tzuhu, Taoyuan, Taiwan

Gender: Male

Religion: Methodist

Race or Ethnicity: Asian

Sexual orientation: Straight

Occupation: Head of State, Military

Nationality: China

Executive summary: President of Nationalist China

Military service: Imperial Japanese Army (1909-1911)

Father: Chiang Zhaocong

Mother: Wang Caiyu

Wife: Mao Fumei (arranged; b. 1882, div. 1927, d. 1939)

Son: Chiang Ching-Kuo (President of Nationalist China, 1978-88; b. 27-Apr-1910, d. 13-Jan-1988)

Daughter: Chiang Chien-Hua

Son: Chiang Wei-kuo (adopted; b. 6-Oct-1916, d. 22-Dec-1997)

Mistress: Yao Zhicheng (concubine, b. 1889, d. 1972)

Mistress: Chen Jieru (concubine, b. 1906, d. 1971)

Wife: Madame Chiang Kai-Shek (b. 1898, m. 1-Dec-1927, d. 2003)

University: Paoting Military Academy (1906)

University: Military State Academy, Japan (1907-9)

President of Taiwan 1950-1975

Ran Away From Home

Declared Holy War against Communist rebels (4-Apr-1948)

Heart Attack

Time Person of the Year With Madame Chiang Kai-Shek, 1937

Birthday Is Holiday 31-Oct Chiang Kai-shek's Birthday (Taiwan)

Chinese Ancestry
